intro: Lomatophyllum anivoranoense, commonly known as the Anivoranoan lomatophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the island of Anivorano in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
